intro: Dimorphanthes hispida, commonly known as the rough dimorphanthes, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is characterized by its hairy, glandular stems and leaves, which give it a distinctive, rugged appearance. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pale yellow in color. It thrives in arid or semi-arid environments and is often found in rocky or sandy soils. Dimorphanthes hispida is a member of the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers.
